info.title: ApiManagementClient
info.description: Use these REST APIs for performing operations on Certificate entity in your Azure API Management deployment. Certificates can be used to setup mutual authentication with your Backend in API Management. For more information refer to [How to secure backend using Mutual Auth Certificate](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/api-management/api-management-howto-mutual-certificates).

get.description: Lists a collection of all certificates in the specified service instance.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: serviceName
parameters.description: The name of the API Management service.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: |   Field     |     Usage     |     Supported operators     |     Supported functions     |</br>|-------------|-------------|-------------|-------------|</br>| name | filter | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith | </br>| subject | filter | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith | </br>| thumbprint | filter | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith | </br>| expirationDate | filter | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt |     | </br>

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: Number of records to return.

parameters.name: $skip
parameters.description: Number of records to skip.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: Subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

200.description: Returns a collection of Certificate entity.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Gets the details of the certificate specified by its identifier.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: serviceName
parameters.description: The name of the API Management service.

parameters.name: certificateId
parameters.description: Identifier of the certificate entity. Must be unique in the current API Management service instance.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: Subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

200.description: The response body contains the specified Certificate entity.

ETag.description: Current entity state version. Should be treated as opaque and used to make conditional HTTP requests.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

put.description: Creates or updates the certificate being used for authentication with the backend.

externalDocs.description: How to secure back-end services using client certificate authentication in Azure API Management

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: serviceName
parameters.description: The name of the API Management service.

parameters.name: certificateId
parameters.description: Identifier of the certificate entity. Must be unique in the current API Management service instance.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: ETag of the Entity. Not required when creating an entity, but required when updating an entity.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: Subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

data.description: Base 64 encoded certificate using the application/x-pkcs12 representation.

properties.description: Parameters supplied to the CreateOrUpdate certificate operation.

200.description: The certificate details were successfully updated.

ETag.description: Current entity state version. Should be treated as opaque and used to make conditional HTTP requests.

201.description: The new certificate was successfully added.

ETag.description: Current entity state version. Should be treated as opaque and used to make conditional HTTP requests.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: serviceName
parameters.description: The name of the API Management service.

parameters.name: certificateId
parameters.description: Identifier of the certificate entity. Must be unique in the current API Management service instance.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: ETag of the Entity. ETag should match the current entity state from the header response of the GET request or it should be * for unconditional update.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: Subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

head.description: Gets the entity state (Etag) version of the certificate specified by its identifier.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: serviceName
parameters.description: The name of the API Management service.

parameters.name: certificateId
parameters.description: Identifier of the certificate entity. Must be unique in the current API Management service instance.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: Subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

200.description: Specified certificate entity exists and current entity state version is present in the ETag header.

ETag.description: Current entity state version. Should be treated as opaque and used to make conditional HTTP requests.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.
